SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
App
Main class that interacts with user to play the game Inherited by TUI: Terminal User Interface and GUI: Graphical User Interface
Back
This class represents the back face of a card.
BackDeserializer
This class allows to deserialize correctly the Back class in gson.
Board
This class represents the gaming board of a player, in which he can place cards.
BoardController
This class represents the GUI controller that controls all the phases of the game.
Card
This class represents a generic card It has an id
Change
This class contains the changes made by the current player.
ChangeMessage
Message sent by the server to the client to send the Change object that contains the updated info
ChatMessage
This class represents a chat message.
ChosenColorMessage
Message sent by the client to the server to choose a color
ChosenGoalMessage
Message sent by the client to the server to choose the personal goal The executeServer method calls a controller method in order to achieve the goal of the message
Client
This interface of the client
ClientHandler
This class is responsible for handling the connection with the client.
ClientHolder
This class is a utility class that holds a static reference to the Client object.
ClientMain
Executable for Client Parameters to add when launching file: --tui | -t: use TUI instead of GUI --rmi | -r : use RMI connection instead of TCP connection --port | -p : set port of server to next int --ip | -a : set address of server to next string
ClientTCP
This class represents the client It contains the internal information useful for the client and the actions it can do to interact with the other players and with the server
CodexNaturalis
Main class for the project It will start the server or the client based on the arguments
Color
Enumeration that stores the game's cards color
ColorChooser
Auxiliary class to change the color of the terminal characters
ConnectionState
Enumeration with all the possible ways a player can connect to server
ConnectionStateMessage
Message sent by the server to the client to notify the updated State of the Game
ConnectMessage
Message sent by the client to the server to connect to a standby game The executeServer method calls a controller method in order to achieve the goal of the message
Controller
This class acts as the controller of the model It transforms the requests made by the client into actions on the game Extends from the Observable class for the observer design pattern
Coordinates
This class helps BoardController to work with the screen coordinates of all the JavaFx elements
Corner
This class represents a corner of a face.
CornerDeserializer
This class allows to deserialize correctly the Corner class in gson.
CornerState
Enumeration of the corner states of the cards in the game
Deck<T>
This class represents a deck It can be shuffled It can be drawn from the top It can be checked if it's finished
Direction
Enumeration of the directions of the cards in the game
Evaluator
Evaluator class, used by goal cards and gold cards to give the players points Strategy design pattern implemented
EvaluatorDeserializer
This class allows to deserialize correctly the Evaluator class and its subclasses in gson.
EvaluatorPoints
Subclass of evaluator, simply returns the number of points given by the card
EvaluatorPointsPerChair
Subclass of evaluator, returns the number of points given by the card by counting the number of chairs in the board Example of chair: |> # backrest -| . |> # seat -> # This particular chair is pointed in the UPLEFT Direction (0, +1)
EvaluatorPointsPerCorner
Subclass of evaluator, returns the number of points times the corners covered by the last placed face on the board
EvaluatorPointsPerResource
Subclass of evaluator, returns the number of points given the requested resources the number of resources on the board
EvaluatorPointsPerStair
Subclass of evaluator, returns the number of points given by the card by counting the number of stairs in the board Example of stair: # # # This particular stair is pointed in the UPLEFT Direction (0, +1)
Face
This class represents the face of a card.
FirstConnectionMessage
Message sent by the client to the server to create a game and connect to it The executeServer method calls a controller method in order to achieve the goal of the message
FirstPlayerCreateGameController
This class represents the GUI controller that controls the setup phase, during which the first Player has to authenticate by choosing his nickname and the number of players of the Game
Front
This class represents the front face of a card.
FrontDeserializer
This class allows to deserialize correctly the Front class in gson.
Game
This class represents a Game It implements GameInterface
GameAlreadyCreatedErrorMessage
Message sent by the server to the client to notify that the game is already created.
GameAlreadyCreatedException
This exception is used to notify the player in login mode that there is a game already created.
GameClientModel
Class to store the simplified game model in the client The information are sent one by one with the Change messages from the server
GameDB
This class is responsible for saving and loading the game state.
GameFullErrorMessage
Message sent by the server to the client to notify that the game is full.
GameFullException
This exception is thrown when a user tries to join a game that is already full
GameInterface
This interface is used to define the methods that game exposes to the controller
GenericException
This exception is used in order to indicate the main class of possible malfunctions in Server
GetAvailablePositionMessage
Message sent by the client to the server to get the available positions The executeServer method calls a controller method in order to achieve the goal of the message
GetGameInfoMessage
Message sent by the client to the server to get the info of the Game The executeServer method calls a controller method in order to get the info of the Game
GetWinnerMessage
Message sent by the client to the server to get the winner The executeServer method calls a controller method in order to achieve the goal of the message
GoalCard
This class represents a Goal Card It can be private or common goal It has an evaluator, which will give points to the players
GoalCardDeserializer
This class allows to deserialize correctly the GoalCard class in gson.
GoalDeck
This class represents a deck of goal cards It has a list of goal cards It can be shuffled It can be drawn from the top It can be checked if it's finished
GoldCard
This class represents a Gold Card It extends PlayableCard
GoodMessage
Message sent by the server to the client to notify that everything has been done correctly
GUIApplication
This class is responsible for starting the graphical user interface of the application.
HelloApplication
This class is the main entry point for the JavaFX application.
IOHandler
A utility class for handling input and output operations.
LobbyController
This class represents the GUI controller that controls the Lobby, where the connected players wait until the reaching of the number chosen by the first player
MenuController
This class represents the GUI controller that controls the phase during which the first Player has to choose between two options: create a new game or load an existing game
Message
This class represents a generic message that can be sent through the network It is used to send messages between the server and the client
MessageListener
This interface is used for the observer design pattern.
MethodChoice
Enum of all the possible methods that can be called by TUI client
NicknameAlreadyInUseErrorMessage
Message sent by the server to the client to notify that the nickname is already in use.
NicknameAlreadyInUseException
This exception is thrown when the Nickname provided by the user is already used by someone else
NicknameInvalidErrorMessage
Message sent by the server to the client to notify that the nickname is invalid.
NicknameInvalidException
This exception is thrown when a user gives an invalid nickname
NoRequirementsErrorMessage
Message sent by the server to the client to notify that the requirements, when trying to place a face are not met.
NormalConnectionController
This class represents the GUI controller that controls the connection phase, during which the Player has to authenticate by choosing his nickname
NumberPlayersWrongErrorMessage
Message sent by the server to the client to notify that the chosen number of players is wrong.
NumberPlayerWrongException
This exception is thrown when a user gives an invalid number of players
Observable
This class acts as the observer in the observer design pattern
PickMessage
Message sent by the client to the server to pick a card The executeServer method calls a controller method in order to achieve the goal of the message
PingMessage
Message to verify the connection of the receiver of the message
PlaceMessage
Message sent by the client to the server to place a face on the board.
PlaceStartingMessage
Message sent by the client to the server to place a face of the Starting Card on the board.
PlayableCard
This class represents a Playable Card It has a front and a back It can be visible or not
PlayableCardDeserializer
This class allows to deserialize correctly the PlayableCard class and its subclasses in gson.
PlayableDeck
This class represents a deck of playable cards
Player
This class represents the player, containing all the attributes and methods to play his game
PlayerClientModel
Class to store the simplified player model in the client The information are sent one by one with the Change messages from the server
PlayerDisconnectedMessage
Message sent by the server to the client to notify that one player has disconnected and therefore the game ends.
PlayersColor
Enumeration that stores the player's colors
Position
This class represents a position in the game board.
ReconnectMessage
Message sent by the client to the server to load and reconnect to an existing game.
RequirementsNotMetException
This exception is thrown when a user tries to place a card but they haven't fulfilled the card's requirements inside their board
Resource
Enumeration of the resources in the game
ResourceCard
This class represents a Resource Card It extends PlayableCard
RMIClient
This class acts as the client when using RMI connection
RMIHandler
Auxiliary class needed for RMI clients to interact with controller
RMIMessageListener
Auxiliary class needed for RMI clients to be called by the controller
RMISpeaker
Interface used by RMI clients to interact with the model
ScreenPosition
A utility class for managing tokens' positions on the Standing Board This method receives the points associated to each token and calculates the coordinates (x,y) that the image should have on the screen
SendAvailableColorsMessage
Message sent by the server to the client to send the available colors to the client
SendAvailablePositionMessage
Message sent by the server to the client to send the available positions to the client
SendPossibleGoalsMessage
Message sent by the server to the client to send the possible goals to choose from
SendWinnerMessage
Message sent by the server to the client to send the winner(s) of the game
Server
This class is the server that listens for incoming connections from clients and creates a new thread and a new ClientHandler for each client.
ServerHandler
This class is responsible for handling the client's connection with the server.
StartingCard
This class represents a Starting Card It extends PlayableCard
State
Enumeration that stores all of the possible game states
TUIApplication
This class is responsible for starting the terminal user interface of the application.
WinningController
This class represents the GUI controller that controls the winning phase, during which the Player sees the winner(s) and the general standings of the game with all the player's points
WrongTurnErrorMessage
Message sent by the server to the client to notify that it is not the correct action.
WrongTurnException
Exception for when a client requests to do an illegal action
